intro: Sebastiania grisebachiana var. virens, commonly known as the green-sepal sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. It typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. This variant is distinguished by its persistent green sepals, which remain visible even after flowering.
